channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The Waratahs No.10 and the incoming Wallabies coach haven't even met yet but the pair are already getting to know each other behind the scenes.
item.title: 'He's a cool dude': Why Harrison and Rennie should get on like a house on fire

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic is not even close to being over, and is in fact speeding up in some parts of the world, World Health Organisation chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria expects further rise in COVID-19 cases as PM's office deploys support staff; Australian death toll stands at 104

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX200 is tipped to rebound at Tuesday's open after positive data and improved COVID stats fuelled an overnight rally on Wall Street.
item.title: ASX set for opening bounce as sentiment swings

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: The distraught parents and aunts of a young man killed during a brawl in Oakleigh's Eaton Mall have visited the scene to pray.
item.title: Man dead, four arrested after Oakleigh brawl

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Emergency crews were called to the scene on Bowen Bridge Road at the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital about 7.30am. Motorist are urged to avoid the area.
item.title: Cyclist killed after collision with truck outside Brisbane hospital

item.description: 2020 has seen both the most destructive sell-off since the Great Depression and Wall Street's best quarter in 22 years. And the rollercoaster ride is set to continue.
item.title: 'Fasten your seatbelts': Sharemarket mayhem set to continue

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Authorities are engaging in the mass sterilisation of Uighur women with three or more children to curb Muslim population, says report
item.title: UK companies urged to review China supply chains amid 'demographic genocide' claims

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: The building watchdog has issued a warning to new home builders as the housing industry reported enormous increases in interest and conditional housing sales over the beginning of June.
item.title: 'Don't panic sign': WA home builders lured by cash splash urged to watch out for dodgy contracts

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The finding of Jane Rimmer’s body in 1996 was the breakthrough Perth homicide detectives had been waiting for.
item.title: Jane Rimmer: How 'miraculous' discovery of body revealed clues to Claremont killer

item.description: Shannon Scott Westerman Smith, 38, admits to stabbing Jacqueline Francis in the neck with a kitchen knife - but denies it was murder because he was insane at the time.
item.title: 'In love' patient claims he was insane when he slashed WA support worker's throat

item.description: Iron ore and gold may seem unlikely bedfellows, but in the current coronavirus pandemic they are combining to try and hold up Australia's reputation as the "lucky country".
item.title: Iron ore, gold are keeping Australia's luck from running out

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for strong start as Wall Street jumps

item.description: Former police officer Joseph James DeAngelo has avoided the death penalty for 13 murders across California in the 1970s and '80s, as part of a deal with US prosecutors.
item.title: Golden State killer pleads guilty after groundbreaking investigation

item.description: The US maker of a drug shown to shorten recovery time for severely ill COVID-19 patients says it will charge $US2340 for a typical treatment course.
item.title: Pharma giant Gilead's price for coronavirus drug draws criticism

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The state's rugby boss Paul Doorn insists the community game won't be compromised despite all 12 development officers being shown the door.
item.title: 'Our priority has been to survive': More than a quarter of staff let go at NSW Rugby

item.description: Experts say the 10.1 million official cases and more than 500,000 deaths are serious undercounts of the true pandemic toll, due to limited testing and missed mild cases.
item.title: 'We are reaping the whirlwind now': Worst virus fears emerging in poor or war-torn countries

item.description: The last time Ben Stokes captained a team he was a teenager. Now he is poised to lead the England Test team against the West Indies.
item.title: Captaining England would be 'huge honour', says Stokes

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Police have been told an unknown man entered the home and fired the shot before fleeing the area in a white or grey car.
item.title: Man dies after being shot in the leg at Sydney home

item.description: A surge in Boeing shares following a test flight of its 737 MAX gives Wall Street and hopes of more stimulus boosted Wall Street, setting up the ASX to jump higher at the open.
item.title: ASX set for strong open as Wall Street ends higher on Boeing bump

item.description: The deal that values the TV reality star's three-year-old business at $US1 billion.
item.title: Kim Kardashian West sells 20% stake in beauty brand for $US200m

item.description: Thee coronavirus pandemic forced the company to close shows around the world, bringing one of the best-known brands in live performance to its knees.
item.title: Cirque du Soleil files for bankruptcy

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Ali Khorami has told a Sydney court his actions were related to energy healing.
item.title: GP accused of indecent assault tells court he was engaging in 'tantric healing'

item.description: The social media site's new content policy said communities and users that promoted hate based on identity or vulnerability would be banned.
item.title: Reddit bans pro-Trump forum in content crackdown

item.description: Seven Network US correspondent Amelia Brace has described to a US congressional committee how she was shot by non-lethal projectiles and hit by a truncheon.
item.title: Australian reporter testifies about police beating outside White House

item.description: The pandemic is not even close to being over, and is in fact speeding up in some parts of the world, the head of the World Health Organisation says.
item.title: Coronavirus pandemic 'is not even close to being over', WHO chief says

item.description: A white couple stood outside their mansion and pointed guns at protesters in St Louis as the group marched toward the mayor's home to demand her resignation.
item.title: Couple draw guns at protesters heading to St Louis mayor's home

item.description: The court struck down a Louisiana law regulating abortion clinics in the first big abortion case of the Trump era.
item.title: US Supreme Court strikes down strict Louisiana abortion clinic law

item.description: Chinese investors are angry and it is set to force Beijing to backpedal on rules meant to clamp down on the unruly underbelly of its banking system.
item.title: China's financial system is running out of room

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The South Pole, the most remote part of the planet, has been warming at triple the global average, as natural variability joins with climate change to produce an abrupt shift in temperature trends.
item.title: 'Nowhere to hide': South Pole warms up with climate change a factor

item.dc:creator: Brooke Lumsden
item.description: Graduate teachers are still walking into classrooms with little to no training in gifted education, and are rarely receiving support or guidance from above.
item.title: Some of our brightest still slipping under the radar

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The first Indigenous Australian to win Olympic gold is behind the campaign to scrap the IOC's Rule 50 and wants a "black voice" on the AOC's athletes commission.
item.title: 'Athletes shouldn't be silenced': Peris joins call for Olympic protest ban to go

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: The American failure to respond to a Russian plan to pay the Taliban to kill US troops raises profound questions.
item.title: The Morrison government doesn't want to talk about Trump and the shocking Russian bounty story

item.dc:creator: Hanna Mills Turbet
item.description: Victoria's energy regulator has revealed 10,000 small business owners are paying top dollar for gas because they are locked into costly default gas contracts.
item.title: ‘Pick up the phone’: How small businesses can make big energy savings

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Never heard of the boutique Macquarie Street practice? Those in legal and conservative political circles certainly have.
item.title: Speed and Stracey, the under-the-radar legal team representing Dyson Heydon

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, June 30

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The Industry Super Australia chairman says their push for rule changes could put at risk $19.5 billion of planned infrastructure and property investment by industry super funds.
item.title: 'Hugely disruptive': Combet accuses Liberal MPs of undermining super system

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: Hint: you can't do it alone. And you shouldn't.
item.title: How to stop being a bystander and stand up to racism and sexism

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Income for each NSW public school student increased by $583 between 2009 and 2018, compared with $2520 per student at independent schools.
item.title: Growth in money for private school students outstrips public schools

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Financial services startup Zeller will now start building its products after securing $6.3 million in a funding round lead by local VC heavyweight Square Peg.
item.title: Fintech Zeller aims to plug business banking gaps

item.description: The nation is missing out on electric cars the rest of the world loves.
item.title: 'A global dirt magnet': Australia is losing out from fuel efficiency failures

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Labor will target uncertainty about JobKeeper as it ramps up campaigning in the final week of the Eden-Monaro byelection.
item.title: Labor urging Eden-Monaro voters to send Liberals messages on JobKeeper

item.description: From decision fatigue to the absence of regular routine, it appears the initial adrenaline rush of lockdown has well and truly subsided.
item.title: Zero motivation? Completely exhausted? You're not alone

item.dc:creator: Tim Costello
item.description: Exactly who is making decisions on public health in NSW – is it the government or the gambling industry?
item.title: Premier should heed the health advice on gambling just as she did for COVID

item.description: In western Sydney, its collection will be seen by more visitors and have more variation than ever.
item.title: Powerhouse Parramatta will be bigger and better than before

item.description: Calls for Labor MP to be suspended from parliament, even though he has not been charged, point to a modern McCarthyism.
item.title: Shades of McCarthyism as forces encircle Moselmane

item.dc:creator: Ellen Fitzgerald
item.description: "Tarana Tiger” found dead, French set for first nuclear test and “terrorists” outlawed in Northern Ireland.
item.title: In the Herald: June 30, 1966

item.description: Australia had committed front-line troops to Vietnam. 720 raw recruits reported to the Army's Marrickville training depot.
item.title: From the Archives, 1965: The day sergeant majors smiled on the new recruits

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: Who Gets to Stay in Australia? captures the life-changing moments when participants are told whether they can call Australia home or will be asked to leave.
item.title: SBS series shines light on 'incredibly complicated' immigration process

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: Drug dealers and cash businesses use poker machines in NSW to wash dark money, experts and insiders say, but regulators have not acted since 2010.
item.title: Poker machines used to launder cash and avoid tax

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, June 30
